results.name: Score Board
results.description: Find the carefully hidden 'Score Board' page. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: Email Leak
results.description: Perform an unwanted information disclosure by accessing data cross-domain. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Error Handling
results.description: Provoke an error that is not very gracefully handled. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: Forged Review
results.description: Post a product review as another user or edit any user's existing review. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Login Admin
results.description: Log in with the administrator's user account. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Login Jim
results.description: Log in with Jim's user account. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Login Bender
results.description: Log in with Bender's user account. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Password Strength
results.description: Log in with the administrator's user credentials without previously changing them or applying SQL Injection. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Five-Star Feedback
results.description: Get rid of all 5-star customer feedback. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Forged Feedback
results.description: Post some feedback in another users name. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Redirects Tier 1
results.description: Let us redirect you to a donation site that went out of business. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: Redirects Tier 2
results.description: Wherever you go, there you are. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Basket Access Tier 1
results.description: View another user's shopping basket. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Basket Access Tier 2
results.description: Put an additional product into another user's shopping basket. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Payback Time
results.description: Place an order that makes you rich. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Confidential Document
results.description: Access a confidential document. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: Forgotten Developer Backup
results.description: Access a developer's forgotten backup file. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Forgotten Sales Backup
results.description: Access a salesman's forgotten backup file. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Admin Section
results.description: Access the administration section of the store. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Product Tampering
results.description: Change the href of the link within the Ps4 $25 Gift Card product description into https://owasp.slack.com. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Vulnerable Library
results.description: Inform the shop about a vulnerable library it is using. (Mention the exact library name and version in your comment) (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Weird Crypto
results.description: Inform the shop about an algorithm or library it should definitely not use the way it does. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Easter Egg Tier 1
results.description: Find the hidden easter egg. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Easter Egg Tier 2
results.description: Apply some advanced cryptanalysis to find the real easter egg. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Forged Coupon
results.description: Forge a coupon code that gives you a discount of at least 80%. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Upload Size
results.description: Upload a file larger than 100 kB. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Upload Type
results.description: Upload a file that has no .pdf extension. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Arbitrary File Write
results.description: Overwrite the Legal Information file. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Extra Language
results.description: Retrieve the language file that never made it into production. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: CAPTCHA Bypass Tier 1
results.description: Submit 10 or more customer feedbacks within 10 seconds. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Zero Stars
results.description: Give a devastating zero-star feedback to the store. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: Imaginary Challenge
results.description: Solve challenge #999. Unfortunately, this challenge does not exist. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Login Bjoern
results.description: Log in with Bjoern's Gmail account without previously changing his password, applying SQL Injection, or hacking his Google account. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Login CISO
results.description: Exploit OAuth 2.0 to log in with the Chief Information Security Officer's user account. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Login Support Team
results.description: Log in with the support team's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Login MC SafeSearch
results.description: Log in with MC SafeSearch's original user credentials without applying SQL Injection or any other bypass. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Premium Paywall
results.description: Unlock Premium Challenge to access exclusive content. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Reset Jim's Password
results.description: Reset Jim's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Reset Bender's Password
results.description: Reset Bender's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Reset Morty's Password
results.description: Reset Morty's password via the Forgot Password mechanism with his obfuscated answer to his security question. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Reset Bjoern's Password Tier 2
results.description: Reset the password of Bjoern's internal account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: NoSQL Injection Tier 1
results.description: Let the server sleep for some time. (It has done more than enough hard work for you) (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: NoSQL Injection Tier 2
results.description: Update multiple product reviews at the same time. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: NoSQL Injection Tier 3
results.description: All your orders are belong to us! (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Retrieve Blueprint
results.description: Deprive the shop of earnings by downloading the blueprint for one of its products. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Typosquatting Tier 1
results.description: Inform the shop about a typosquatting trick it has become victim of. (Mention the exact name of the culprit) (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Typosquatting Tier 2
results.description: Inform the shop about a more sneaky instance of typosquatting it fell for. (Mention the exact name of the culprit) (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: JWT Issues Tier 1
results.description: Forge an essentially unsigned JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user jwtn3d@juice-sh.op. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: JWT Issues Tier 2
results.description: Forge an almost properly RSA-signed JWT token that impersonates the (non-existing) user rsa_lord@juice-sh.op. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Misplaced Signature File
results.description: Access a misplaced SIEM signature file. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Deprecated Interface
results.description: Use a deprecated B2B interface that was not properly shut down. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: XXE Tier 1
results.description: Retrieve the content of C:\Windows\system.ini or /etc/passwd from the server. (This challenge is not available on Docker!) (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: XXE Tier 2
results.description: Give the server something to chew on for quite a while. (This challenge is not available on Docker!) (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: RCE Tier 1
results.description: Perform a Remote Code Execution that would keep a less hardened application busy forever. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: RCE Tier 2
results.description: Perform a Remote Code Execution that occupies the server for a while without using infinite loops. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Blockchain Tier 1
results.description: Learn about the Token Sale before its official announcement. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Security Policy
results.description: Behave like any "white-hat" should. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Steganography Tier 1
results.description: Rat out a notorious character hiding in plain sight in the shop. (Mention the exact name of the character) (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Supply Chain Attack
results.description: Inform the development team about a danger to some of their credentials. (Send them the URL of the original report or the CVE of this vulnerability) (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Christmas Special
results.description: Order the Christmas special offer of 2014. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: User Credentials
results.description: Retrieve a list of all user credentials via SQL Injection (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Admin Registration
results.description: Get registered as admin user. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: XSS Tier 0
results.description: Perform a reflected XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)">. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: XSS Tier 1
results.description: Perform a DOM XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)">. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: XSS Tier 2
results.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a client-side security mechanism. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: XSS Tier 3
results.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> without using the frontend application at all. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: XSS Tier 4
results.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> bypassing a server-side security mechanism. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Change Bender's Password
results.description: Change Bender's password into slurmCl4ssic without using SQL Injection or Forgot Password. (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: XSS Tier 5
results.description: Perform a persisted XSS attack with <iframe src="javascript:alert(`xss`)"> through an HTTP header. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Multiple Likes
results.description: Like any review at least three times as the same user. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: SSTi
results.description: Infect the server with juicy malware by abusing arbitrary command execution. (This challenge is not available on Docker!) (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: SSRF
results.description: Request a hidden resource on server through server. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Login Amy
results.description: Log in with Amy's original user credentials. (This could take 93.83 billion trillion trillion centuries to brute force, but luckily she did not read the "One Important Final Note") (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: XSS Tier 1.5
results.description: Perform an XSS attack with <script>alert(`xss`)</script> on a legacy page within the application. (Difficulty Level: 2)

results.name: Reset Bjoern's Password Tier 1
results.description: Reset the password of Bjoern's OWASP account via the Forgot Password mechanism with the original answer to his security question. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Access Log
results.description: Gain access to any access log file of the server. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: DLP Failure Tier 1
results.description: Identify an unsafe product that was removed from the shop and inform the shop which ingredients are dangerous. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: DLP Failure Tier 2
results.description: Dumpster dive the Internet for a leaked password and log in to the original user account it belongs to. (Creating a new account with the same password does not qualify as a solution.) (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: XSS Tier 6
results.description: Embed an XSS payload </script><script>alert(`xss`)</script> into one of our marketing collaterals. (Difficulty Level: 6)

results.name: Lost in Recycling
results.description: Find an old Recycle request and inform the shop about its unusual address. (Mention the entire delivery or pickup address in your comment) (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Two Factor Authentication
results.description: Solve the 2FA challenge for user "wurstbrot". (Disabling, bypassing or overwriting his 2FA settings does not count as a solution) (Difficulty Level: 5)

results.name: Expired Coupon
results.description: Successfully redeem an expired campaign coupon code. (Difficulty Level: 4)

results.name: Privacy Policy Tier 1
results.description: Read our privacy policy. (Difficulty Level: 1)

results.name: Privacy Policy Tier 2
results.description: Prove that you actually read our privacy policy. (Difficulty Level: 3)

results.name: Repetitive Registration
results.description: Follow the DRY principle while registering a user. (Difficulty Level: 1)
